passages.text: Monday, 1 September 2025
Top Call | Video | Country Top Calls | Key Ratings | Target Price Changes

Following accelerated \(26\%\) yoy growth in cloud revs in FY1Q26, mgmt commented positively that cloud revs growth acceleration is likely to sustain in coming quarters driven by strong demand in AI infrastructure and compute power. The strategies stepped- up investment in quick commerce has translated to encouraging user growth (+25% yoy in MAU), order frequency, and synergies to CMRand GMV. Mgmt noted CMR is likely to sustain similar growth rate as past

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

two quarters implying around \(10\% +\) yoy despite high base, suggesting positive incremental growth contributed by quick commerce investment. Mgmt targets Rmb1 trillion GMV for quick commerce in three years as it expects its leading average- daily order share position (80mn) to sustain with substantially improvement of UE in next few months. Post estimate revisions, we raise target prices \(+26\% / + 27\%\) to US\\$187/HK\\$183. Maintain Buy on solid Al+Cloud exposure and multiplier effect of synergies between B2C and quick commerce.

Although BYD 1H- earnings missed, we expect 2H NP/car to rebound. BYD reported Rmb6.36bn 2Q25 NP and missed consensus' Rmb7- 9bn and our forecast of Rmb10.3bn; We estimate 2Q25 NP/car fell to around Rmb4.9k, from 1Q25's Rmb8.7- 8.8k level. Overall the 2Q miss was due to: (1) 1H25 autos GPM missed by 0.5- 1.3ppt as the price cut didn't help to improve 1H25 volume enough- 1H25 volume up \(33\%\) YoY but - 19% HoH (worse than 1H24's - 8.8% HoH seasonal vol decline); (2) An Rmb1bn special incentive was being paid to dealers in 2Q25; (3) Rmb43bn CAPEX was being booked in 2Q at \(16\%\) QoQ pace (1H25 CAPEX at Rmb80.5bn, +71% YoY); (4) 2Q R&D QoQ surged by Rmb1.15b; (5) 1H25 D&A surged by \(20\%\) YoY- we estimate underlying 2Q25 D&A surged QoQ by Rmb1- 1.4bn; (6) 2Q financial income fell by Rmb570mn QoQ; Other net income + spending QoQ delta was negative at - Rmb150m.

The Constitutional Court permanently removed Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office on Friday, with Deputy Premier Phumtham Wechayachai and current cabinet remaining as caretakers (likely except Paetongtarn as current Minister of Culture). The House Speaker will convene the Lower House to vote for next PM, but there is not yet a specific timeline. Recall that the transition from ex- PM Srettha Thavisin to PM Paetongtarn took two days in August 2024. Our base- case scenario, though situation is very fluid, assumes Phue Thai Party successfully nominates its last eligible candidate, Chaikasem Nitisiri (a former attorney general and justice minister), as the new prime minister. We see this as a compromise scenario given the current ruling coalition holds just 256 seats vs. the opposition's 239 (ThaiPBS Jun 24th) which could result in challenges in policy execution, let alone passing key laws. This could eventually lead to a call for house dissolution and elections.
Thailand Equities - Citi Recommended Top Buys and Sells

Indonesia's protests over the past week, sparked by grievances including anger over Rp50mn/month housing allowances for lawmakers, have hit its financial markets - weakening the rupiah and pushing bond yields up. With unemployment remaining high and layoffs seen across industries, the ongoing protests risk further

hurting consumer and business sentiment. Big companies unlikely to spend much on capex in 2H25, based on our channel checks. However, fiscal spending is set to accelerate, focusing on social programs, which will count rates (3 x 25bps) through January 2026, according to our economist. Danan's Rp50trn (US\(3.1bn) Patriot Bond program aims at attracting offshore Indonesian money to fund domestic energy and AI projects, incenting it with team amnesty. We maintain our cautious view on the market, preferring defensive BBCA, GOTO, BRIS, ASII, ICBP, and commodity names MDKA and ADMR given the market's relatively low valuation of 11.5x forward P/E.

US\(16.6bn inflow into equity funds - In the week of 27 August 2025, US\)19.7bn of inflow went into bond funds while equity funds had US\)16.6bn. Global funds saw US\)5.8bn of inflow. US funds also had US\)8.5bn of flows coming back in. European funds however were hit by US\)1.2bn of net redemptions. In Japan, equity funds saw US\)0.9bn of outflow while their Money Market funds saw similarly sized inflows.
Chris Ma | Yue Hin Pong | Chris Montagu | Hong Li

TrendForce released Aug DRAM/NAND contract pricing data. With Aug DDR4 PC DRAM contract price having soared MoM on limited supply, DDR5 PC DRAM/Server DRAM/NAND price continued stable growth due to supply concentration on HBM. Looking towards 2H25E, we see solid demand catalysts: [1] Mobile DRAM content increase from 12GB LPDDR5T adoption in iPhone 17; [2] likely better- than- expected demand for general server DRAM from hyperscalers; and [3] rising SOCAMM adoption. Baking- in such upside potentials, we revise up our memory ASP forecasts. We reiterate Buy on Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix.

Sunny Optical attended Citi's 2025 China TMT day (29- Aug). Key takeaways: (1) The company explained that revenue guidance is more feasible at expressing the company growth trajectory, and (2) expressed a positive attitude toward cooperation with Goertek. (3) Co. is positive on the multi- camera trend in vehicles and LiDAR adoption along with rising L3+ penetration. (4) Miniature CCM with molding packaging technology sees robust growth (500%+ YoY) and Android customers camera upgrade roadmap (periscope, variable aperture etc.) is clear. (5) The company also anticipates shipment growth for the US customers this year.
Kyna Wong | Karen Huang | Kevin Chen

Real GDP surprised upwards to \(7.8\% \text{YoY}\) in 1QFY26, largely explained by a lower- than- expected GDP deflator (0.9%YoY), which narrowed the real- nominal growth gap. Unseasonable rains in May- June negatively impacted some industrial activity, but manufacturing was resilient. Services recorded decade- high growth at \(9.3\% \text{YoY}\) . Strong services growth (higher informal) and the impact of deflator on real GDP might explain the gap between GDP data and the market's more bearish growth view. We now expect FY26 GDP growth of \(7.1\% \text{YoY}\) (previously \(6.7\%\) ), with 1H at \(7.5\%\) and 2H at \(6.6\%\) . Key uncertainties include the impact of a potential GST cut and US tariffs. Weaker growth in 2HFY26 incorporates unfavorable base effects and some tariff impact. Below- \(7\%\) real growth in FY26 is possible if tariffs remain at \(50\%\) . This GDP print reaffirms our view of RBI being on a long hold barring any material tariff- related growth impact, which may not be visible by October.
Samiran Chakraborty | Baqar M Zaidi, CFA
GDP deflector falls to multi- year low of below \(1\%\)

According to Reuters (29 Aug), prosecutors sought a 15- year prison term for Kakao founder Brian Kim, alleging stock manipulation related to Kakao's acquisition of SM Entertainment in 2023. The verdict from this initial trial is scheduled for 21 Oct. While a final ruling could take years due to appeals, the initial verdict will likely weigh on investor sentiment toward Kakao. Even if a conviction is upheld, there would be no obligation to unwind Kakao's stake in SM Entertainment. However, a guilty ruling could impact Kakao's qualification as a fit- and- proper shareholder of its regulated financial subsidiaries - KakaoBank, KakaoPay Securities, and KakaoPay Insurance - potentially forcing the group to divest its stakes (note).

Sea attended Citi's ASEAN C- Suite Corporate Day held in Singapore on Aug 27- 28. Key highlights: 1) Shopee update and margin; 2) Brazil performance and competitive landscape; and 3) fintech products. As we noted in post- 2Q25 note (link), we believe that Sea Ltd. will continue to execute solidly to grow and balance

investment and profitability as Shopee continues to improve logistic cost per delivery and grows traction in higher- ASP category, while momentum in Brazil further strengthens. More transparent disclosure sharing of operating metrics and growth expectation should help increase forecast visibility and strengthen investor confidence. Maintain Buy and US\(206 target price. Alicia Yap, CFA

Telekom Malaysia's (TM) 1H25 revenues and reported PATAMI at face value were below Bloomberg consensus at \(47\%\) each, however, cost control (Ref: Fig 1) provided some EBITDA relief and there were significant (RM42.8m) exceptional expenses that dragged the bottom line. Adjusting for such, we estimate recurring profit was \(50\%\) of consensus ( \(55\%\) of Citi). Management maintained its prior FY25E guidance (low single digit revenue, flat EBIT) as TM Global (C2C) and TM One (B2B) are expected to execute on projects in 2H25 to drive a revenue rebound. Meanwhile, management indicated that the first 64MW of its Nxera data center would be completed in 2Q26 and that the facility would likely be fully taken up. We maintain our forecasts, TP and Buy rating on TM. Luis Hilado

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient

valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "- " and "- " respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
Any price(s) of instruments mentioned in recommendations are as of the prior day's market close on the primary market for the instrument, unless otherwise stated.

The completion and first dissemination of any recommendations made within this research report are as of the Eastern date- time displayed at the top of the Product. If the Product references views of other analysts then please refer to the price chart or rating history table for the date/time of completion and first dissemination with respect to that view.

Regulations in various jurisdictions require that where a recommendation differs from any of the author's previous recommendations concerning the same financial instrument or issuer that has been published during the preceding 12- month period that the change(s) and the date of that previous recommendation are indicated. For fundamental coverage please refer to the price chart or rating change history within this disclosure appendix or the issuer disclosure summary at https://www.citvlicocity.com/cvr/ppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

Citi Research has implemented policies for identifying, considering and managing potential conflicts of interest arising as a result of publication or distribution of investment research. A description of these policies can be found at https://www.citvlicocity.com/cvr/ppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

The proportion of all Citi Research research recommendations that were the equivalent to "Buy", "Hold", "Sell" at the end of each quarter over the prior 12 months (with the % of these that had received investment firm services from Citi in the prior 12 months shown in brackets) is as follows: Q2 2025 Buy 33% (63%), Hold 44% (51%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.4% (86%); Q1 2025 Buy 33% (63%), Hold 44% (51%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.5% (87%); Q4 2024 Buy 32% (64%), Hold 44% (52%), Sell 23% (44%), RV 0.4% (92%); Q3 2024 Buy 33% (61%), Hold 44% (52%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.4% (80%). For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy" means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.

European regulations require a 5 year price history when past performance of a security is referenced. CitiVelocity's Charting Tool (https://www.citvlicocity.com/cv2/#go/CHARTING_3_Equities) provides the facility to create customisable price charts including a five year option. This tool can be found in the Data & Analytics section under any of the asset class menus in CitiVelocity (https://www.citvlicocity.com/). For further information contact CitiVelocity support (https://www.citvlicocity.com/cv2/go/CLIENT_SUPPORT). The source for all referenced prices, unless otherwise stated, is DataCentral, which sources price information from Thomson Reuters. Past performance is not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future results. Forecasts are not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future performance.

Citi Research broadly and simultaneously disseminates its research content to the Firm's institutional and retail clients via the Firm's proprietary electronic distribution platforms (e.g., Citi Velocity and various Global Wealth platforms). As a convenience, certain, but not all, research content may be distributed through third party aggregators. Clients may receive published research reports by email, on a discretionary basis, and only after such research content has been broadly disseminated. Certain research is made available only to institutional investors to satisfy regulatory requirements. The level and types of services provided by Citi Research analysts to clients may vary depending on various factors such as the client's individual preferences as to the frequency and manner of receiving communications from analysts, the client's risk profile and investment focus and perspective (e.g. market- wide, sector specific, long term, short- term etc.), the size and scope of the overall client relationship with the Firm and legal and regulatory constraints.

Pursuant to Comissão de Valores Mobiliários Resolução 20 and ASIC Regulatory Guide 264, Citi is required to disclose whether a Citi related company or business has a commercial relationship with the subject company. Considering that Citi operates multiple businesses in more than 100 countries around the world, it is likely that Citi has a commercial relationship with the subject company.

Citi Research may provide different research products and services to different classes of customers (for example, based upon long- term or short- term investment horizons) that may lead to differing conclusions or recommendations that could impact the price of a security contrary to the recommendations in the alternative research product, provided that each is consistent with the rating system for each respective product.

values.コメント: 15%では、車両を米国で生産するメリットは少ない。コストの要因だけではなく、労働力や品質の確保という観点でも課題が大きい。2035年に向けてであれば、よりEVシフトが進む可能性もあるため、投資計画としても起こり得る。また、開発に関連した生産部品やサプライチェーンの変化は、自動車部品でより深刻な影響を生じさせる可能性があるため、業界全体にとって重要な課題となる。

values.アナリスト名: マクドナルド・アレーム、井上 恭平
values.コメント: コマツは人件費や鉄鋼価格が比較的高いことを理由に国内での生産能力拡大について消極的である。ただ、今後12-24ヶ月ではクボタが米国での現地生産比率をき上げる可能性や、日立建機がジョベルの米国現地生産の検討をする可能性がある。

values.アナリスト名: 江沢 孝太、藤原 敏範
values.コメント: 企業規模が大きく、米国事業の重要性の高い、これまでも大規模M&Aを行ってきた総合商社がある等の検討をすると、日立（社会インフラ事業とITサービス）とデューイ（エンターテイメント）がスクリーニングされる。1万件のM&A案件を審査し、その上に米国企業が米国で大きく事業投資や事業を行うと宣言して、対象企業が中国サプライチェーンの取り込みを見込める投資についてはこの2社が挙げられる。

values.アナリスト名: 内藤 貴之、山崎 理子
values.コメント: 中国サプライチェーンの取り込みを見込む投資についても東南アジアが中心であり、米国向けその新規投資は見受けられない。一方、5-10年の長期視点では、米国のデータセンターインフラ向けでオルタネーターがデックが設備投資を拡大する可能性はある。ニデックは基本的に現地生産を指向している。また、TDK等の二次電池において米国での生産が必要となる規模に拡大した場合は、投資に踏み切る可能性はあろう。
大規模投資を行うとすれば富士フイルム（CDMO）が考えられる。既に53億円を投じ、現状の投資が決定済みで、ここから追加で3-40億円あると見ている。ただしこれは電ではなく、バイオ医薬品の生産・供給に貢献することになる。日系専門製造装置メーカーは製品・部材メーカーし日本国内に見積しているため、米国での設備投資を検討する可能性は低いだろう。

ソフトバンクグループ（以下SBG）は、AIに関する投資としてStargate Projectを表明しており、Open AIとAIに必要なデータセンターを計画している。現状、具体的な進捗は見えてないものの4年間で5000億円という大規模な計画が進められると推測する。500億円の投資については、エクイティでの出資に加え、主にProject Finance等の外部調達によるレバレッジを活用した投資になるだろう。SBGの直接的な投資は500億円の数パーセント程度に留まる可能性はあるが、米国におけるAIインフラの拡大に貢献するProjectになるだろう。それ以外に、OpenAI、Ampereだけで2025年中に合計で30-50億円を投資することもできる。SBGは米国企業のM&Aを検討している。
米国への投資の観点では、信越化学が2024年からルイジアナ州に対して塩ビ樹脂の建設許可申請を行っているが、本作の大部分のなかで検討されるようなことはないだろう。そのほか、ライフサイエンス（CDMO）向けの材料などでは、今後米国での投資が増加する可能性もあるが、現時点では、各社から明確な投資スタンスが変化している様子はみられない。

武田薬品は米国投資を30億ドル規模と明言。ただし、新規工場建設ではなく既存投資を含め発表から計画されていたもの。協和キリンは米国において3億ドル規模のバイオ工場建設を決定しており、2027年竣工に向け建設を進めている。一方で、MACについては医薬品及びメドテック社が検討を維持しており、今後も継続する見込みである。米国ターゲットの大手はのベンチャー企業であり、米国のイノベーションが世界をリードする、日常の大会はいずれも機会をうかがっている状況である。
積水ハウスや大和ハウスなど大手住宅会社は、買収を通じた米国での事業拡大方向が強い。米国の住宅不足を背景に各社とも中規模な買収を評価しておりビルダーを中心に連続的な買収が行われよう。不動産でも今後の金利低下による合併や個人で投資を拡大させる動きがある。三井不動産はデータセンターへの投資を着実に進めており（エクイティ投資で1,500億円）。今後投資額はさらに増えていくであろう。

figures.title: Thailand - Movement of SET Index around Elections

series.name: Note / Comment
values: Election after coup filled with optimism but led to May controversy. Followed by reconciliation government
Strong bank performance both pre and post-election
Broad rally in all domestic sectors - Banks, Properties, Energy
Slump into 1997 Asia Financial Crisis after election
First Thaksin victory. Still in recovery post 1997. Key sectors: Banks, Properties
Thaksin landslide victory. Global Fed tightening cycle - domestic sectors are strong - Banks, Commerce, Property, Energy
Controversial election leading to coup in Sep-2006. Key outperforming sector: Commerce, Bank, Energy, Property
Energy and Petrochem led pre election rally
Telco and Commerce/Retail strong into election. Hit post election
Telco/Transport/Food strong into and post election. Banks, Petrochem weak throughout
Agri, Energy & Petro weak into election while Banks and Commerce outperformed
